page.title: 20LOCAL HISTORY IN WEST CAMBS.
page.content:
Change comes slowly to the western edge of Cambridgeshire. The twentieth century has made its mark with modern houses and new farming technology; but the history of the area is still very much apparent. The church, thatched cottages and village cross at Stow Longa have changed little since the Middle Ages, while the disused railway line and the wartime airfield recall more recent history. Above all, the Anglo-Saxon place-names of Catworth and Stow Longa are reminders that the first inhabitants settled here long before the time of the original Domesday Book.
* * * * * * * * * * This survey was carried out by Nora Butler, Aileen Dickens, Anne Hellett Barbara Turvey and Wenda Watson, of Kimbolton Women's Institute.
